workers.default.xml package¶

Submodules¶

workers.default.xml.marc_xml_generator module¶

workers.default.xml.marc_xml_generator.generate_marc_xml(work_path, data, template)[source]¶

Merges article data with the journal data, then calls the generic generate_xml function for all articles. :param str work_path: Path to put the generated XML :param dict data: Journal metadata :param str template: Marc-XML template :return: None

workers.default.xml.tasks module¶

workers.default.xml.xml_generator module¶

workers.default.xml.xml_generator.generate_xml(work_path, data, template_string, target_path='', target_filename='ojs_import.xml')[source]¶

Builds Jinja2 template and writes it to target file. :param str work_path: Path to put the generated XML :param dict data: Journal metadata :param str template_string: XML template :param str target_path: self explanatory… :param str target_filename: self explanatory… :return str: Path to generated XML file

workers.default.xml.xml_validator module¶

workers.default.xml.xml_validator.validate_xml(xml_file_path, schema_file_path=None)[source]¶

Parses the given XML file. This throws syntax error if not well formed. When the additional schema parameter s given it also checks the XML file against that. :param str xml_file_path: path to XML file to be validated :param str schema_file_path: (optional) path to XSD to be checked against :raises etree.XMLSyntaxError: if XML document is not well-formed :raises etree.DocumentInvalid: if XML document does not adhere to XSD :return: None
